## Step 1

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
kc_data <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/difiore/ada-datasets/main/KamilarAndCooperData.csv")
set.seed(42)
```

## Step 2

```{r}
p1 <- ggplot(kc_data, aes(x= Body_mass_female_mean, y = MaxLongevity_m)) +
  geom_point(color = "#bf5700")

p2 <- ggplot(kc_data, aes(x= log(Body_mass_female_mean), y = MaxLongevity_m)) +
  geom_point(color = "#bf5700")

p3 <- ggplot(kc_data, aes(x= log(Body_mass_female_mean), y = log(MaxLongevity_m))) +
  geom_point(color = "#bf5700")

library(patchwork)
(p1 | p2 | p3)  + plot_annotation(tag_levels = "I")
```

## Step 3: Linear models

```{r}
m1 <- lm(MaxLongevity_m ~ Body_mass_female_mean, data = kc_data)
m2 <- lm(MaxLongevity_m ~ log(Body_mass_female_mean), data = kc_data)
m3 <- lm(log(MaxLongevity_m) ~ log(Body_mass_female_mean), data = kc_data)
```

## Step 4: Residuals

```{r}
m1_residuals <- m1$residuals
m2_residuals <- m2$residuals
m3_residuals <- m3$residuals
```

## Step 5: QQ Plot

```{r}
```

## Step 6: Linear Model Plots

```{r}
plot(m1)
```

## Step 7: Shapiro Test

```{r}
# Linear Model 1
shapiro.test(m1_residuals)

# Linear Model 2
shapiro.test(m2_residuals)

# Linear Model 3
shapiro.test(m3_residuals)
```
